Register.Name: CSR
Register.Comment: Control and status register
Register.BitComments: Enable the on card test pulser!Run the test pulser for one spill or continuously (0=run once)!Enable the flash gate!CMB pulse function (0=applied to the flash gate, 1= applied to the CMB LEDs!Issue a reset to the AFE deserializer logic in the FPGA!Issue a MIG DDR interface reset!Reset readout sequencer 1: Reset, 0: No action!Issue a general reset. The AFE FIFOs, Trigger counter, Spill counter and Readout sequencer are reset.!Reset the serial controller in the AFE chips!Clear FM receive parity error!!!!!

Register.Name: SDRAM_WritePointer
Register.Comment: SDRam Write address (2=upper bits, 3=lower bits)

Register.Name: SDRAM_ReadPointer
Register.Comment: SDRam Read address (4=upper bits, 5=lower bits)

Register.Name: SDRAM_read_swapped
Register.Comment: Byte swapped SDRam read data port

Register.Name: SDRAM_read
Register.Comment: Un-swapped SDRam data port

Register.Name: MIG_Status
Register.Comment: MIG status register
Register.BitComments: DDR Reset Busy!DDR Cal Done!WRITE command FIFO full!WRITE command FIFO empty!WRITE data FIFO full!WRITE data FIFO empty!READ command FIFO full!READ command FIFO empty!READ data FIFO full!READ data FIFO full!!!!!

Register.Name: MIG_burst_size
Register.Comment: always 8 for now

Register.Name: HISTO_THRESH_AFE0
Register.Comment: Histogram counter threshold for AFE 0

Register.Name: HISTO_THRESH_AFE1
Register.Comment: Histogram counter threshold for AFE 1

Register.Name: HISTO_COUNT_INTERVAL
Register.Comment: A 12 bit counting interval in steps of 1 millisecond.

Register.Name: HISTO_CHAN_SEL
Register.Comment: A three bit register specifying which of the eight AFE channels is applied to the threshold (for both AFEs).

Register.Name: HISTO_COUNT0
Register.Comment: Histogram count AFE0 (0x14=upper bits, 0x15=lower bits)

Register.Name: HISTO_COUNT1
Register.Comment: Histogram count AFE1 (0x16=upper bits, 0x17=lower bits)

Register.Name: MUX_SEL
Register.Comment: Selects which of 16 DAC trim resistors is connected to the second level multiplexer. Set Mux enable to 0 before taking SiPM pulsed data.

Register.Name: CHAN_MASK
Register.Comment: A four bit register to select which CMBs to read out. Bits 0..3 enable CMBs 1..4

Register.Name: TEST_COUNTER
Register.Comment: A write to this address defines the 32 bit test counter. A read from this address displays the value of bits and increments all 32 bits of the counter after the read.

Register.Name: ONE_WIRE_COMMAND
Register.Comment: One wire command register
Register.BitComments: Bits 0..7: if an individual write transaction is requested, the lower eight bits of this register are sent to the one wire interface.!!!!!!!!Bit 8: Start the read temperature sequencer. A complete read temperature sequence will execute when this bit is set. The read value of this bit will return a 0 until the sequence is complete.!Bit 9: Start the read ROM sequencer. A complete ROM read sequence will execute when this bit is set. The read value of this bit will return a 0 until the sequence is complete.!!!!!

Register.Name: ONE_WIRE_CONTROL
Register.Comment: One wire control register
Register.BitComments: Bit 0..3: Selects which CMB read data is stored in the register file!!!!Bit 4: Request a write transaction!Bit 5: Request a read transaction!Request a reset transaction!Bit 7: Transaction status. Returns a ‘1’ when transaction is in progress!Bit 15..8: Transaction bitcount (N-1). For a write set to seven. For a 72 bit read set to 71.!!!!!!

Register.Name: ONE_WIRE_READ0
Register.Comment: One wire control register

Register.Name: ONE_WIRE_READ1
Register.Comment: One wire control register

Register.Name: ONE_WIRE_REA2
Register.Comment: One wire control register

Register.Name: ONE_WIRE_READ3
Register.Comment: One wire control register

Register.Name: ONE_WIRE_READ4
Register.Comment: One wire control register

Register.Name: AFE_INPUT_FIFO_EMPTY_FLAG
Register.Comment: Shows the level of the empty flags of the 16 FIFOs used to buffer data destined for the DDR RAM.

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH0
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan0

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH1
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan1

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH2
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan2

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH3
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan3

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH4
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan4

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH5
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan5

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH6
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan6

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH7
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan7

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH8
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan8

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH9
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan9

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH10
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan10

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH11
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan11

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH12
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan12

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH13
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan13

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH14
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan14

Register.Name: BIAS_DAC_CH15
Register.Comment: 12 bit DACs with a span of ±4.096V. Chan15

Register.Name: LED_INTENSITY_DAC_CH0
Register.Comment: Four 12 bit DACs with a span of 0..14V. Addresses 0x40..0x43 Apply to CMB 1..4. Chan0

Register.Name: LED_INTENSITY_DAC_CH1
Register.Comment: Four 12 bit DACs with a span of 0..14V. Addresses 0x40..0x43 Apply to CMB 1..4. Chan1

Register.Name: LED_INTENSITY_DAC_CH2
Register.Comment: Four 12 bit DACs with a span of 0..14V. Addresses 0x40..0x43 Apply to CMB 1..4. Chan2

Register.Name: LED_INTENSITY_DAC_CH3
Register.Comment: Four 12 bit DACs with a span of 0..14V. Addresses 0x40..0x43 Apply to CMB 1..4. Chan3

Register.Name: BIAS_BUS_DAC0
Register.Comment: Two 12 bits DACs with a possible span of 0..80V. Address 0x44 applies to CMB1..2

Register.Name: BIAS_BUS_DAC1
Register.Comment: Two 12 bits DACs with a possible span of 0..80V. Address 0x44 applies to CMB3..4

Register.Name: AFE_VGA0
Register.Comment: Two 12 bits DACs with a span of 0..1.54V. Address 0x46 applies to AFE 0

Register.Name: AFE_VGA1
Register.Comment: Two 12 bits DACs with a span of 0..1.54V. Address 0x46 applies to AFE 1

Register.Name: SETUP_DAC_CH0
Register.Comment: Dont' touch this. Chan0

Register.Name: SETUP_DAC_CH1
Register.Comment: Dont' touch this. Chan1

Register.Name: SETUP_DAC_CH2
Register.Comment: Dont' touch this. Chan2

Register.Name: SETUP_DAC_CH3
Register.Comment: Dont' touch this. Chan3

Register.Name: SETUP_DAC_CH4
Register.Comment: Dont' touch this. Chan4

Register.Name: SETUP_DAC_CH5
Register.Comment: Dont' touch this. Chan5

Register.Name: SETUP_DAC_CH6
Register.Comment: Dont' touch this. Chan6

Register.Name: SPILL_TRIG_COUNT
Register.Comment: Reads the number of triggers received during the spill.

Register.Name: SPILL_NUMBER
Register.Comment: Increments once per spill. Use buffer reset to reset this counter.

Register.Name: EVENT_WORD_COUNT
Register.Comment: Increments once per spill. Use buffer reset to reset this counter.

Register.Name: SPILL_WORD_COUNT
Register.Comment: Read the word count from the most recent spill

Register.Name: UPTIME
Register.Comment: A counter showing the number of seconds since the last FPGA reset

Register.Name: TRIG_TIME_STAMP
Register.Comment: A 32 bit register showing the time stamp of the most recent trigger

Register.Name: PULSER_TRIG_DELAY
Register.Comment: An eight bit value in steps of 6.28ns that specifies the delay between receipt of a pulser trigger command from the controller and the issuing of a test pulse to the CMB LEDs. The desire is to obviate the need for pipeline readjustment between data taking and pulser triggers.

Register.Name: SPILL_ERROR
Register.Comment: Read the spill error register
Register.BitComments: [0] One or more of the AFE FIFOs has overflowed![1] Event FIFO empty. This should be the case at the end of a spill.![2] Parity error on the command link from the controller to the TDC.!!!!!!!!!!!!

Register.Name: SPILL_STATE
Register.Comment: Read the spill state register
Register.BitComments: [0] The DDR write sequencer is busy.![1] Spill End Flag.![2] Spill Gate.!!!!!!!!!!!!

Register.Name: FLASH_GATE_CONTROL
Register.Comment: Broadcast. Flash gate control.
Register.BitComments: [0] Enable the flash gate.![1] Select the CMB pulse routing. 0: Flash Gate, 1: LED flasher.![2] LED Flasher signal source. 0: Test pulser, 1: Flash Gate.!!!!!!!!!!!!

Register.Name: FLASH_GATE_TURN_ON
Register.Comment: Broadcast. A write to this address defines the time in the microbunch in steps of 6.28ns that the flash gate is asserted, that is when the SiPM voltage is lowered. The microbunch duration is 270 steps

Register.Name: FLASH_GATE_TURN_OFF
Register.Comment: Broadcast. A write to this address defines the time in the microbunch in steps of 6.28ns that the flash gate is de-asserted, that is when the SiPM voltage is raised.

Register.Name: TRIG_CONTROL
Register.Comment: Broadcast. Trigger control register.
Register.BitComments: [0] Writing a ‘1’ to this bit position sends a software trigger.![1] Selects the trigger input type as a pulse or an FM data stream. The assumption is that a trigger pulse comes from the LEMO connector, the FM encoded trigger message comes from the RJ-45 connector. The microprocessor controls the multiplexer that routes either the LEMO or the RJ-45 signal to the trigger input on the FPGAs.![2] Trigger Inhibit. if trigger inhibit is enabled, this bit goes to one in response to a trigger![3] Trigger Inhibit enable.![4] Spill Inhibit. if spill inhibit is enabled, this bit goes to one in response to end of spill. Writing a ‘1’ to this position sets a request to clear the inhibit. Clear spill inhibit will wait until any spill in progress finishes before clearing and allow more triggers.![5] Clear spill inhibit.![6] Spill Inhibit enable.![7] Not used.![8] Enable the on card test pulser.![9] Run the test pulser for one spill or continuously. 1: Run once 0: Run continuously!!!!!

Register.Name: HIT_DEL_REG
Register.Comment: Broadcast. Specifies the number of pipeline stages the hit data traverses before being presented to the first level FIFO. This is used to compensate for trigger delays. The least count is 12.56 ns and the span is eight bits. The minimum delay setting is one and increases monotonically up to a setting of 255.

Register.Name: NUM_SAMPLE_REG
Register.Comment: Broadcast. Specifies the number ADC samples per trigger to record. 1..254 Samples.

Register.Name: TEST_PULSE_FREQ
Register.Comment: Broadcast. Test Pulser frequency word. The rate is 0.0741 Hz per count.

Register.Name: TEST_PULSE_DURATION
Register.Comment: Broadcast. A write to this address defines the length of the internally generated spill in seconds.

Register.Name: TEST_PULSE_INTERSPILL
Register.Comment: Broadcast. A write to this address defines the length of the internally generated gap between spills in seconds. This is only significant if the test pulser is set to run continuously.

Register.Name: COARSE_COUNT_INTI
Register.Comment: A write to this address defines the lower eight bits of the initial count of the time stamp counter. This can be used to match the delay between receipt of a trigger at the controller and the FEB.

Register.Name: TEST_PULSE_DELAY
Register.Comment: Broadcast.A write to this address defines the delay in 6.28 ns clock ticks between receipt of a test pulse trigger from the controller and the firing of the trigger logic on the FEB
